assistantResponses.title: Network Security
assistantResponses.content: To secure your network, I recommend: 1) Enable WPA3 encryption for your WiFi 2) Set up a guest network for visitors 3) Update firmware on all network devices 4) Implement MAC address filtering 5) Use a strong, unique password

assistantResponses.title: Speed Optimization
assistantResponses.content: Here are some ways to optimize your network speed: 1) Position your router in a central location 2) Use a wired connection for stationary devices 3) Update router firmware 4) Set up Quality of Service (QoS) rules 5) Consider upgrading to WiFi 6 if your devices support it

assistantResponses.title: Device Troubleshooting
assistantResponses.content: To troubleshoot connection issues: 1) Restart the problematic device 2) Restart your router and modem 3) Check if other devices are affected 4) Verify you're connected to the correct network 5) Try forgetting the network and reconnecting 6) Update device drivers or firmware if available

assistantResponses.title: Network Monitoring
assistantResponses.content: For effective network monitoring: 1) Enable logging on your router 2) Set up bandwidth monitoring tools 3) Check connected devices regularly 4) Monitor for unusual traffic patterns 5) Configure alerts for network events 6) Review logs periodically for security issues

assistantResponses.title: VPN Setup
assistantResponses.content: To set up a VPN for your network: 1) Choose a reliable VPN provider 2) Install the VPN client on your router or devices 3) Select an appropriate server location 4) Configure split tunneling if needed 5) Test your connection to verify encryption is working properly

assistantResponses.title: VLAN Configuration
assistantResponses.content:
The 'Add VLAN' workflow configures a new VLAN across all networks in designated organizations.

Here's an overview of the required inputs and key steps:

**Inputs:**
- Organizations: Select organizations
- VLAN ID: 1-4094
- VLAN Name: Text field
- Security: Open, WPA2, or splash screen

**Steps:**
1) Get organization networks
2) Get network devices
3) Configure VLAN on upstream switch ports
4) Add VLAN
5) Configure VLAN settings
6) Document results

To set up VLANs, navigate to the Network settings and select VLAN configuration. From there you can create new VLANs, assign IP ranges, and manage VLAN tagging for your network devices.
